intro: Gamochaeta serranoi, commonly known as the serrated gamochaeta, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean islands. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas. Its leaves are lance-shaped and serrated, giving it its common name. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in summer, attracting various pollinators.
